In the 124th episode of Mann Ki Baat, the Hon‚Äôble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi celebrated the spirit of startups shaping New India. From over 3,000 textile startups reviving handlooms to 200+ space tech startups transforming aspirations into lunar missions, Bharat is innovating across every corner.

He highlighted how youth-led ventures are fuelling sports startups, building homegrown equipment and management ecosystems. With innovation driving inclusivity, from village looms to space labs, the journey towards Atmanirbhar Bharat is thriving.

Startup India stands proud to support these changemakers, crafting a self-reliant, opportunity-filled future for all.
Let‚Äôs build for Bharat. Let‚Äôs grow together.

This World Nature Conservation Day, we're reminded that the planet‚Äôs resources are finite, and the time to act is now.

At IKP Knowledge Park, we believe that science and innovation are not just tools, but powerful catalysts for conservation. From biodiversity tracking to sustainable materials, we support startups and researchers working at the intersection of environment and impact.

Watch how innovation can restore balance, and how we can build a greener tomorrow, one breakthrough at a time.

#WorldNatureConservationDay #Sustainability #ScienceForConservation #InnovationForImpact 

United Nations UN Environment Programme UN Biodiversity The Nature Conservancy IUCN WWF WWF-India MoEF&CC Deepanwita Chattopadhyay Bindu Nishal Dr. Priyankana Mukherjee Apoorva Bhatnagar Sridhar Ramanathan IKP EDEN IKP PRIME Aaqib Jameel Vithal K Lakkineni, Ph.D. Dedeepya Chermala Vishaka Sawan Ranajit Sen Anuradha Barua Sudha Kalyani Bommareddy, Ph.D. Rohika B Rajeswari Sepana Shreyas Kudva

It was a pleasure hosting Varun Raghuveeran and Sooraj K Babu from Dr. Moopen's iNEST | BioNEST Incubation Centre. We're excited about the potential this partnership holds and look forward to co-creating impactful healthcare solutions together.

üî¨ Honored to Announce ‚Äì Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) joins as Government Partner for the CII Global Genomics Summit 2025, scheduled for 25 August 2025 in New Delhi.

With Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC)‚Äôs pioneering leadership in biotechnology innovation and translational research, this partnership further strengthens our commitment to advancing genomics for precision healthcare, agriculture, and sustainable development.

The Summit will focus on:
‚úÖ Precision medicine and rare disease genomics
‚úÖ Agrigenomics and biodiversity
‚úÖ Genomics infrastructure, AI, and ethical frameworks
‚úÖ Innovation ecosystems driving biotech transformation

With Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) esteemed partnership, we move a step closer to shaping India‚Äôs leadership in genomics, biotechnology, and innovation-led growth.

On #NationalScienceDay2025, CCAMP is excited to share some of its work that demonstrates the power of science to solve societal problems 

We are proud to be fostering several next gen deep-science based innovative solutions and research that are bridging critical gaps in healthcare, agriculture and environment

Some of these include
üß™Mitigating antimicrobial resistance, strengthening maternal and child health, treating degenerative illnesses and cancer, and developing diagnostics for infectious diseases,
üß™Replacing chemical pesticides with biologicals, boosting crop productivity and farmer incomes, and increasing food security
 üß™Capturing carbon and adopting climate resilient solutions

And, much more!

Presenting you a short film on the C-CAMP ecosystem where young ideas are born, deep science questions are pursued, nurtured and empowered to leapfrog to global leadership

Excited to launch the 6th edition of C-CAMP CARB-X AMR Quest 2025, our flagship national programme to foster and amplify innovation-focused R&D efforts in this space.

AMR innovators from any domain ‚Äî Diagnostics, Non-traditional therapeutics, Preventatives, and Direct Acting Small Molecules ‚Äî can apply.

Focus Areas:
*Therapeutics for gram-negative infections
*Diagnostics for typhoid (low-resource settings), neonatal sepsis

What‚Äôs in it for you?
*3-month CCAMP AMR Accelerator: mentorship across science, business, IP, regulation, & fundraising, and networking
*Participation in a fully funded International Conference, CCAMP AMR Innovator School
*Access to CCAMP Technology Workshops & Events

Announcing the availability of completely indigenous Research Use Dengue Reference Standards!

The inactivated DENV2 and DENV3 serotypes were developed through a collaborative effort by the Centre for Cellular and Molecular Platforms (C-CAMP) & National Centre for Biological Sciences (NCBS).

They are traceable to the World Health Organization International Reference Panel for Dengue Virus Types 1‚Äì4.

please write to us: indx-support@ccamp.res.in

üì¢ ¬†IIT Mandi Catalyst is pleased to invite applications for the Investment Readiness Program.

Join our Investment Readiness Program, a dynamic initiative designed for startups poised for commercialization and ready to secure investments for expansion. This program serves as a vital bridge between startups and the market, offering invaluable support and guidance to accelerate growth.

Program Highlights:
üîπ Craft a compelling pitch tailored for investors.
üîπ Benefit from personalized mentorship by industry experts.
üîπ Validate the financial viability and growth strategy of your venture.
üîπ Showcase your startup to potential investors on Demo Day.
üîπ Refine your pitch with feedback from seasoned professionals.

Demo Day:
Cap off your 90-day sprint with Demo Day, where cohort startups gain exclusive access to a curated audience of venture capitalists, angel investors, and grant providers. This is your chance to shine as you pitch your venture to influential stakeholders, paving the way for potential investments and strategic partnerships.

Don't miss this opportunity to propel your startup to new heights. Join our Investment Readiness Program and unlock the resources and connections you need to thrive in the competitive market landscape.

üìÖ Last date to apply: August 7th, 2025

üëâ To apply for the program, click on the following link: https://lnkd.in/gDYCbEeE

Thrilled to announce that the highly anticipated third edition of India's Premier Series of Pitch Event, Bharat Pitchathon 4.0, is coming to 20+ States.

#IITMandiCatalyst ¬†#IITMandi #BharatPitchathon #StartupIndia #StartupEcosystem #Entrepreneurship #InvestorConnect #InnovationInIndia #HeadstartIndia #BuildForBharat #MakeInIndia #IncubationPartner

IIT Mandi, in collaboration with SIDBI, on 25th July celebrated a significant milestone with the graduation ceremony of the Rural Entrepreneurship Development Program (REDP) at IIT Mandi Catalyst. The event highlighted the transformative journey of rural entrepreneurs and featured an insightful session on the Mission Swavalamban Stand-Up India scheme.

The keynote address was delivered by Shri THR Samad, DGM, ROCH, SIDBI. He delivered a compelling talk on SIDBI‚Äôs initiatives to foster entrepreneurship, provided a detailed aspects of the Stand Up India scheme, including minimum loan amounts, promoter contributions, and the Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Stand Up India (CGTMSE).

Welcome & Catalyst Introduction: Mr. Gaurav P. (Manager, IIT Mandi Catalyst) set the stage with an inspiring introduction. He detailed IIT Mandi's support for startups, emphasizing resources, mentorship from faculty, IT support, and validation for ideas.

REDP Overview: Ms. Rewati Lal (Executive, IIT Mandi Catalyst) shared the impactful outcomes of the REDP, empowering rural communities through entrepreneurship.

Experience Sharing: REDP participants showcased their inspiring journeys, reflecting resilience and innovation.

Vote of Thanks: Mr. Anil Singh (General Manager, IIT Mandi Catalyst) concluded the event with heartfelt gratitude to all participants, guests, and organizers.

This event underscores the power of collaboration between IIT Mandi Catalyst and SIDBI in nurturing rural entrepreneurship and driving inclusive growth. Kudos to all the participants and stakeholders for their dedication to building a self-reliant India!

SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India) | Timir Samad
Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Lipsa Rani Panda | Rewati Lal | Sanket Umap

#IITMandi #IITMandiCatalyst #RuralEntrepreneurship #REDP #SIDBI #StartupHimachal #EmpoweringCommunities #EntrepreneurshipDevelopment #MandiHimachal #StartupInHills

IDC School of Design, IIT Bombay hosted Design Clinic to assist SINE startups to improve the design of their products/services with the help of professional designers and IDC students. Startups got an opportunity to present the current design of their product to a design team to get feedback about design from expert designers, get quick-fix solutions immediately, explored future collaboration opportunities.

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
Cut the Fat, Not the Flow

The development sector is drowning in intermediaries‚Äîre-granting agencies, consultants, collectives, and collaboratives.....Too often, they justify their existence with buzzwords like ‚Äúsystems change,‚Äù ‚Äúcapacity building,‚Äù ‚Äúecosystem,‚Äù and ‚Äúplatforms,‚Äù while delivering little beyond roundtables with the same faces in new venues, glossy reports where fonts change more than the data, flashy websites, feel-good videos (about themselves), feel-sad videos (about communities), and databases no one trusts.

The problem isn‚Äôt intermediation‚Äîit‚Äôs bad intermediation. When done well, intermediaries can aggregate demand, align incentives, allocate capital efficiently, and manage risk. But when they morph into self-reinforcing bureaucracies, they stall progress and drain resources, especially when led by people with no personal stake in the outcome. Low "skin in the game" means leaders enjoy asymmetric rewards without bearing consequences. They are insulated from failure, making them risk-averse and impact-light.

We need to rethink the chain. Funders must back proximate actors directly, invest in real capacity, and shift accountability from process to outcomes. The goal isn‚Äôt fewer intermediaries‚Äîit‚Äôs better ones. The best ones are entrepreneurs. They put their credibility, sweat, and future on the line.
Communities don‚Äôt need more gatekeepers. They need partners who deliver.

At Social Alpha, we work with bold innovators solving tough challenges‚Äîfrom sustainable farming to equitable healthcare. As part of our Communications team, you‚Äôll get to turn their work into stories that matter.¬†
Know someone who‚Äôd be a good fit? Or see yourself here?¬†
¬†
Write to us at careers@socialalpha.org with your resume/cover letter.

Find the detailed job descriptions in the links below:
Content Associate - https://lnkd.in/gcTQBUNp
Digital Marketing Associate - https://lnkd.in/g8hdGx4a 
¬†
#NoHashtags #JustImpact

As India‚Äôs agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.¬† 

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen India‚Äôs agricultural resilience.¬† 

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.¬† 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans.

Innovate. Integrate. Inspire.

That was the spirit at the BFI i3 Vimarsh Summit, which brought together 400+ changemakers and ecosystem leaders to explore the future of healthcare innovation, and Venture Center was glad to be part of the conversation!

Our team ‚Äî Dr. Premnath Venugopalan, Soma Chattopadhyay, and Dr. Mugdha Potnis-Lele ‚Äî represented Venture Center at the event. Several of our startups also participated actively in the summit, showcasing their innovations, and engaging with global partners and ecosystem leaders.

A key highlight for us was the signing of a strategic MoU with Blockchain for Impact (BFI) to strengthen our LEAP Global Accelerator program. This collaboration will help Indian science-based startups become globally competitive, with expert support in regulatory strategy, international certifications, clinical validation, and investor readiness.

Thank you to BFI for the platform‚Äîand for the partnership!

Sandeep Nailwal @Dr. Gaurav Singh Pooja Agrawal Satya Prakash Dash

#StartupValuation #FinancialModelling #InvestorReadiness #EarlyStageStartups #VentureStudioEvents

The best startup advice often comes between the slides - in those unscripted moments when successful entrepreneurs share what really happened.

Over the weekend at Ahmedabad University, we witnessed exactly that. Author and entrepreneur Ankur Warikoo sat with aspiring founders and shared the unvarnished truth about purpose, failure, and playing the long game in entrepreneurship.

No sugar-coating. No typical motivational quotes. Just real talk about what it actually takes to build something meaningful.

The energy in the room was electric as young innovators and ecosystem enablers connected over shared challenges and breakthrough moments. These are the conversations that matter - the ones that go beyond pitch decks and funding rounds.

Four incredible startups supported by VentureStudio showcased their innovations:
- CERVICHECK by Pragmatech Healthcare Solutions Pvt. Ltd. by Pragmatech Healthcare Solutions - revolutionizing women's health
- Socal Media - transforming digital engagement
- HasiEco Ventures - building sustainable solutions
- Bijoi | Handloom & Handicraft - preserving traditional crafts with modern innovation

We also celebrated the signing of an MoU with FICCI YFLO Ahmedabad. Huge thanks to Neha Goyal (Chairperson) and Shreyra Siryoya (Jt. Secretary) for making this partnership possible.

Events like these remind me why building an entrepreneurial ecosystem matters. It's not just about funding or mentorship - it's about creating spaces where founders can learn from each other's real experiences.

What's the best unfiltered advice you've received as an entrepreneur? Share below üëá

Hardi Shah Aikya Shetty Palna Patel Ekshika Bhagtani

#Entrepreneurship #StartupEcosystem #Innovation #WomenInBusiness #AnkurWarikoo

ü§ù Exploring Synergies for Future-Ready Tech

iCreate, in collaboration with Geon (a Kabra Extrusiontechnik company), hosted an Industry-Startup Virtual Discovery Session. The session was led by Mr. Anish Chavda, Business Analyst at iCreate, and featured Mr. Saurabh Lad, Strategy Manager at GEON, representing the industry side.

The session aimed to identify synergies and potential collaborations between GEON and seven iCreate-incubated startups ‚Äì Clean Electric, Fasmho¬Æ, Autobits Labs, Vayunotics, Photom Technologies, Aeidth Technologies, and Poweraum Electronics ‚Äì across battery technology, BMS, Industry 4.0, AI, and drones.

GEON shared multiple use case statements and opportunities in EV batteries, cell technology, IoT units, ML solutions, BMS, and energy storage, where startups contributed valuable insights and solutions to explore further collaborations.

üí° Aligned with iCreate‚Äôs vision to empower innovators and bridge the gap between startups and industry, this session reflects our commitment to fostering scalable Deep Tech solutions for real-world challenges.

#iCreateWithYou #InnovationEcosystem #EnergyTech #DeepTechStartups #Industry40 #EVTech #Collaboration #MakeInIndia

Proud to share a pioneering milestone by Oceanlux CCU (Prop + Climate-tech) Architecture, an iCreate-supported Climate Tech startup.

Its bio-inspired air purification system is now live at Adani Jaipur International Airport ‚Äî Asia‚Äôs first, and the world‚Äôs second (after Pittsburgh, USA), such innovation at any airport.

OceanTree ‚Äì a next-gen microalgae-based CCUS device ‚Äì mimics six mature trees, capturing CO‚ÇÇ, SOx, NOx, CO, PM2.5, PM10, and releasing fresh oxygen through artificial photosynthesis. Installed at Terminal 1 and Terminal 2, redefining indoor air quality and the green building concept.
Inaugurated by Mr. Anurag Bhatt, CEO, Adani Jaipur Airport, this initiative aligns with Adani‚Äôs ESG vision and India‚Äôs mission for net-zero innovation.

Oceanlux is not just building a product ‚Äî it's planting a new standard for breathable, sustainable environments.

As part of the #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1, we had the privilege of hosting Dr Amit Ray, a seasoned Naval Architect with the Indian Navy, for an insightful session on the future of marine robotics.

Bringing decades of domain expertise, Dr. Ray shed light on the real-world deployment of underwater systems‚Äîranging from advanced firefighting technologies to the complexities of underwater navigation. He offered a deep dive into the operational trade-offs between AUVs and ROVs, while also unpacking challenges like energy constraints and communication blackouts in subsea environments.

His perspectives bridged defense and industry use cases‚Äîoffering our innovators a rare look into the nuanced demands of underwater robotics from someone who has navigated them firsthand.
